.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, string[] values, bool visible) cil managed

Docs.summary: Instantiates a new **ReportParameter** with a name, multiple values, and a visibility flag.
Gets or sets the name of the parameter.
Gets a collection of `string` objects containing one or more values for the parameter.
Determines whether the parameter can be displayed in the user interface.
Docs.remarks:
## Remarks The <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ReportViewer> control may only display the parameter input user interface if the control's <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ReportViewer.ProcessingMode%2A> property is set to <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ProcessingMode>.
The following conditions must also be met for the parameter input area to be displayed:
- The <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ReportViewer.PromptAreaCollapsed%2A> property of the **ReportViewer** control must be `false` (this is the default value).
- The <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ReportViewer.ShowParameterPrompts%2A> must be `true` (this is the default value).
- The <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ReportParameterInfo.PromptUser%2A> property is set to `true.`
If the **ReportViewer** control is set to <xref:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ProcessingMode> mode, the host application must provide a user interface for accepting parameter values and passing these parameters to the report.
